    • Method Detail

      • lockNonExclusive

        public Lockable.LockHolder lockNonExclusive()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalKeyValueStore
        Declares that a thread is about to perform a non-exclusive task that can run in parallel with other non-exclusive locking tasks.

        This method ensures that non-exclusive operations are properly blocked when an exclusive operation is taking place.

        This method also acquires the non-exclusive lock on the whole database!

        This method must be used together with the try-with-resources pattern. See Lockable.lockNonExclusive() for an example.

        Specified by:
        lockNonExclusive in interface Lockable
        Specified by:
        lockNonExclusive in interface TemporalKeyValueStore
        Returns:
        The object representing the lock ownership. Never null. Will be closed automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

      • lockBranchExclusive

        public Lockable.LockHolder lockBranchExclusive()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalKeyValueStore
        Declares that a thread is about to perform a non-exclusive task that can run in parallel with other non-exclusive locking tasks on this branch.

        This method also acquires the non-exclusive lock on the whole database!

        This method must be used together with the try-with-resources pattern. See Lockable.lockNonExclusive() for an example.

        Specified by:
        lockBranchExclusive in interface TemporalKeyValueStore
        Returns:
        The object representing the lock ownership. Never null. Will be closed automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

      • lockExclusive

        public Lockable.LockHolder lockExclusive()
        Description copied from interface: TemporalKeyValueStore
        Declares that a thread is about to perform an exclusive task that can't run in parallel with other locking tasks.

        This method acquires the exclusive lock on the entire database!

        This method must be used together with the try-with-resources pattern. See Lockable.lockExclusive() for an example.

        Specified by:
        lockExclusive in interface Lockable
        Specified by:
        lockExclusive in interface TemporalKeyValueStore
        Returns:
        The object representing the lock ownership. Never null. Will be closed automatically by the try-with-resources statement.

      • txBuilder

        public ChronoDBTransactionBuilder txBuilder()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionSource
        Creates a new ChronoDBTransactionBuilder for fluent transaction configuration.

        When you have called all relevant configuration methods, use ChronoDBTransactionBuilder.build() to receive the configured ChronoDBTransaction.

        Specified by:
        txBuilder in interface TransactionSource
        Returns:
        The transaction builder.

      • txInternal

        public ChronoDBTransaction txInternal(java.lang.String branch,
                                      long timestamp)
        Description copied from interface: TemporalKeyValueStore
        Opens a transaction for internal use.

        This transaction has significantly fewer preconditions and safety checks for the sake of greater flexibility.

        Specified by:
        txInternal in interface TemporalKeyValueStore
        Parameters:
        branch - The branch to operate on. Must not be null, must refer to an existing branch.
        timestamp - The timestamp to operate on. Must not be negative.
        Returns:
        The new internal transaction. Never null.

      • verifyTransaction

        protected abstract void verifyTransaction(ChronoDBTransaction tx)
        Verification method for implementations of this class.

        The implementing method can perform arbitrary consistency checks on the given, newly created transaction before it is passed back to application code for processing.

        If the implementation of this method detects any conflicts, it should throw an appropriate subclass of ChronoDBTransactionException.

        Parameters:
        tx - The transaction to verify. Must not be null.
